ratings.comment: Caring and relatable prof with kind grading rubrics for exams. Honestly lectures are unnecessary if you are capable of self-study due to the nature of the course content. If you are able to tackle and make a solid effort on 60+% of the problems from the textbook I'd say you are 90% likely to get an A.

This class felt like she was throwing equations at us and we had no clue where they were coming from. The amount of work was also ridiculous since she changed the format going online - she even said that the graders were constantly overwhelmed. If you put in the work (and check solutions!), though, you will get a good understanding of the material.

She's not bad! Gives great real life illustrations. Always hands out plenty of practice materials before the exam. Doesn't do the best at explaining complex topics, but does REALLY well with simple Mechanics explaining
Wendy was a solid prof, she cares that people learn.

Prof. Crone is an intelligent professor and very helpful in office hours and with questions. Her lectures are extremely boring though and hurt my interest in the subject because she takes way too long on algebra and simple math. There's also a ridiculous amount of homework that doesn't really help with learning or the test. Discussions are key.

Professor Crone is an incredibly intelligent professor, but wow her lectures were incredibly boring. The content learned in this course seemed interesting, but most of the time was spent brushing over the derivations and instead doing long calculations. Homework took a long time and was tough to reap valuable information from.

Professor Crone did an alright job teaching this course, but where she excels is going into office hours and asking questions. The course isn't too difficult but if the conceptual topics aren't nailed down you will struggle. Don't be afraid to ask her that nagging question because it will 100% be on the exam.

Her exams were easy but the class was not curved. You can understand her from the lectures, and if you don't you can easily use MecMovies to help you understand. She does some pop quizzes for attendance and you don't have to know the material to answer. She likes to have visual aids (materials) to help understand the topic discussed.

Don't skip classes/discussions especially around test times. Because of how assignments are weighted pop quizzes and attendance checks end up being worth a significant amount. Homeworks are overly difficult, but tests are fair and lectures/slides cover all of the material well.

Wendy Crone is by far the best engineering professor at UW and all her students love her. Her lectures are very clear and she is extremely knowledgeable. I highly recommend going to office hours as she is super helpful. The homework is tough and time consuming, however, it prepares you for the tests. I highly recommend taking any of her courses!

Very good teacher overall. She turns off all of the assistive features for the homework, so you have to struggle until you get the right answer. The first two exams were easy, but the final was significantly harder and almost no one finished it. Generous grader, show work to get partial credit. Take advantage of photo credits (extra credit).

Crone was great. Lectures slides are given before class so they can be used to help with note taking. Tests were pretty easy, and the three projects throughout the semester were fun. Homework takes a hundred years to complete, but it is valuable for studying and graded fairly. Take this class with her!
Lecture hard to understand. Just go through the problems very fast and not clear

Not a good lecturer at all, just monotonously burns through problems and bores you to death. She also found it necessary to completely change the requirements for one type of assignment after we had already completed two of them. Honestly one of my least favorite professors thus far.
She is not a great teacher.
good professor but tough work load. go to class.

Extremely helpful teacher. If you don't understand something, she'll keeping helping you until you do. Examples done in class were exactly what to expect on homework and in exams. If you need to take 303, take it from her!
Great teacher! Is really good at explaining concepts. Makes you work for your grade. Assigns a lot of random assignments and randomly takes attendance but it worth it.

A lot of work for a 3-credit course. Gives trivial assignments randomly to encourage attendance. Grading is fairly generous on exams. Weekly homework often contains material not covered until after the assignment is due. Expect to spend a lot of time in TA's office hours to understand the material and get a good grade. Lecture quality is average.

best professor i ever had. she makes you work like hell for your grade but she makes it rewarding in the end because you learn SO much from her. lectures are done so well and notes are crystal clear. very helpful, nice and friendly in office hours and its obvious she wants to help you. seemed like a lot of work for a 3-credit class.
